content.description: A desperate start gains the diagonal thin crack system. Demanding moves along the diagonal crack lead to a protruding black xenolith and a bolt (crux). From here the route heads straight up. Climb sculpted stone to a rest at the wall's midway ledge. Clip a bolt and boulder up big shelves to an exciting finish in a left-facing corner.
content.protection:
Double set of cams to 1.5"

2 lead bolts

Two-bolt ring anchor

All hardware 1/2" SS
content.location:
Diagonal thin crack running the length of the Sharma wall. Starts ~40 feet left of

Minority Figured

.

content.description: Layback and stem a right-facing fingers corner to a ledge. Move up and left to a bolt then back right (crux) on big shelves. Mantel past the second bolt and finish on a splitter crack layback to the anchors.
content.protection:
Single rack to 3 inches (#3 C4 Camalot)

2 bolts
content.location: Middle of Sharma sector. Starts on obvious right-facing fingers corner.

content.description:
Interesting fun moves the whole way. If only this were longer.

Diagonal up right on multiple parallel edges to reach base of left-slanting 2-ft-deep right-facing corner. Up the corner to the top (one move a bit reachy).

warning

: The rock in this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
No fixed hardware for top anchor or for leading as of 2016.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown.

Top-Roping: Difficult scrambling (low class 5) up R-facing broken gully to left of route to reach diagonal left-to-right ramp above top of route. Build natural (rock thread or horn) or Trad-gear anchor, likely need long slings or short static line.
content.location:
20 ft right from big broken right-facing corner gully (which is the right ene of sector 5 Rebuffat).
